Key Arguments: The proposed bill will degrade trust in government institutions rather than promote it.
The bill's authoritarian approach will decrease public trust and foster disunity.
The exemption of government-authorized content from the bill is seen as hypocritical and unjust.
The bill is compared to policies expected under a Soviet-style or communistic regime, not in a democratic country like Australia.
Notable Quotes: This bill will achieve the opposite effect of its intended purpose.
This is the kind of proposal that someone might expect under a Soviet-style regime. A communistic regime. NOT in Australia.
